citations.narrative:
There are 6 adult dogs over 4 months old not listed on the Acquisition of Dogs on Hand (APHIS Form 7005). Four dogs
have been at the facility for 6 months, two dogs are an employee's dogs living in the kennel. Failure to provide complete
and accurate acquisition and disposition information inhibits APHIS's ability to identify and trace animal movements. Each
dealer, other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and each exhibitor shall make,
keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning each dog or
cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or
which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any
offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control.
To be corrected by: 9-August-2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The walls of the enclosures and the feeding receptacles are not cleaned as often enough to prevent accumulation.
Several enclosures have brown organic material smeared on the walls and the feeding receptacles contain a thick, grey
organic materials and hair buildup. The licensee states they are going to deep clean the enclosures today. The dogs did
not have soiling present. Failure to clean and sanitize as often as necessary does not protect the dogs from exposure to
disease hazards. Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs and cats must be sanitized at least
once every 2 weeks using one of the methods prescribed in paragraph (b)(3) of this section, and more often if necessary
to prevent an accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards.
To be corrected by: 5-August-2024

The attending veterinarian has not completed the regularly scheduled 12 month site visit since 21-March-2023. Regularly
scheduled site visits are essential in determining if all aspects of animal care (nutrition, health, environment, water, and air
quality, etc.) are being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have regularly scheduled visits, not less than once every
12 months, by the attending veterinarian to the facility where animals are kept, to assess and ensure the adequacy of
veterinary care and other aspects of animal care and use.
To be corrected by: 23-August-2024
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection.

The complete physical examinations from head to tail on 72 adult dogs by the attending veterinarian has not be
completed since 21-March-2023. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12 months may result in delay of
treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by ensuring that a complete physical examination from
head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not less than once every 12 months.
To be corrected by: 23-August-2024
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection.

Approximately 25 adult dogs are overdue for their rabies vaccinations. These dogs were given a 1 year rabies vaccine on
21-March-2023. The program of veterinary care states yearly and then every 3 years. The attending veterinarian stated
these dogs are overdue and will have to receive another 1 year vaccine. Failure to follow the Program of Veterinary
Care's vaccine schedule does not ensure the dogs have immunity to potentially contagious and/or deadly diseases. The
licensee must have these dogs vaccinated and follow their program of veterinary care from this day forward.
To be corrected by: 23-August-2023
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There are 6 adult dogs over 4 months old not listed on the Acquisition of Dogs on Hand (APHIS Form 7005). Four dogs 
have been at the facility for 6 months, two dogs are an employee's dogs living in the kennel. Failure to provide complete

cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or 
which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any 
offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. 
To be corrected by: 9-August-2024 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The walls of the enclosures and the feeding receptacles are not cleaned as often enough to prevent accumulation. 
Several enclosures have brown organic material smeared on the walls and the feeding receptacles contain a thick, grey

to prevent an accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards. 
To be corrected by: 5-August-2024 
3.13(a)(1) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The attending veterinarian has not completed the regularly scheduled 12 month site visit since 21-March-2023. Regularly 
scheduled site visits are essential in determining if all aspects of animal care (nutrition, health, environment, water, and air 
quality, etc.) are being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have regularly scheduled visits, not less than once every 
12 months, by the attending veterinarian to the facility where animals are kept, to assess and ensure the adequacy of

To be corrected by: 23-August-2024 
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The complete physical examinations from head to tail on 72 adult dogs by the attending veterinarian has not be 
completed since 21-March-2023. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12 months may result in delay of 
treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by ensuring that a complete physical examination from

To be corrected by: 23-August-2024 
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Approximately 25 adult dogs are overdue for their rabies vaccinations. These dogs were given a 1 year rabies vaccine on 
21-March-2023. The program of veterinary care states yearly and then every 3 years. The attending veterinarian stated 
these dogs are overdue and will have to receive another 1 year vaccine. Failure to follow the Program of Veterinary 
Care's vaccine schedule does not ensure the dogs have immunity to potentially contagious and/or deadly diseases. The 
licensee must have these dogs vaccinated and follow their program of veterinary care from this day forward. 
To be corrected by: 23-August-2023 
An appointment is scheduled with the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
